fields.summary: Modify OpenID login filter and design and modify login page to present both Google OpenID login option and direct login option

fields.description:
See screenshot:

!missing-i18n.png!
fields.summary: Missing i18n on space admin page

fields.description:
Creating a new Confluence Space and associating it with a project is harder than it should be at the moment.

You need to:

# create the space
# associate it with a project (Administration -> Projects -> <Project Name> -> Select confluence space
# set up the app links for the space for FE and Crucible (Space Admin -> Application Links -> FishEye Repository / Crucible Review)

\\
It would be better if associating a space with a project did this for you, or the way to set up the app links for FE/Cru was more intuitive.
fields.summary: Make it easier to set up links to all apps for a new confluence space

fields.description:
Currently it is only possible to assign Source permissions by group. 

Feasible to allow Source permission by user?
fields.summary: Manage Source permissions by individual user accounts

fields.description: The current user interface is basic. This should be improved after the workflow has been stabilized. E.g. add pagination for the users.vm (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Customer+Facing+JIRA+Imports?focusedCommentId=37684227#comment-37684227).
fields.summary: User Interface improvement

fields.description: It would be handy if we could find a way to anonymize customer imports. Thus we could easily write an integration test utilizing this data in order to provoke a bug and fix it.
fields.summary: Spike: Find a way to anonymize customer imports in order to reuse them in integration tests

fields.description: JiraImportFileServiceImpl provides functionality to modify the JIRA import file. The JIRA URL replacement logic was originally extracted from com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.LegacyStudioImportManager (former name com.atlassian.studio.importer.StudioImportManager), the user renaming logic was added in AOD-2656. In order to isolate it, only com.atlassian.jira.config.properties.ApplicationProperties and com.atlassian.studio.common.StudioInfo have to be mocked. The unit contains also the ZIP extraction functionality contained in com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.util.ZipFileInputStream, thus the test should incorporate the tests originally contained in the removed com.atlassian.studio.importer.TestImportZipExtractorImpl (r106231).
fields.summary: Write unit test for com.atlassian.studio.importer.impl.file.JiraImportFileServiceImpl

fields.description: Currently no central exception handling is applied. Most exceptions either go to the logs or are thrown over the web framework boundaries so that they are directly reported to the client. A central exception handler should be added which differentiates between recoverable and non-recoverable exceptions. In case of non-recoverable exceptions the transaction should be rolled-back and a proper message should be reported to the user. In case of recoverable exceptions it should differentiate between exceptions which require user input in order to retry an operation or if it can be solved on the server-side.
fields.summary: Introduce proper exception handling
Alert support on failures

fields.description: The code currently basically resides in the two classes mentioned above. The code should be separated and grouped into smaller chunks whilst applying common design patterns. Also the code should be reviewed in order to clarify if we can find a nicer solution for some hacks.
fields.summary: Refactor StudioImport & DefaultStudioImportManager classes

fields.description:
Requirement: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Customer+Facing+JIRA+Imports?focusedCommentId=37684227#comment-37684227

The postImportStudify() (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer#StudioImporter-SequenceDiagram) currently removes all imported POP3 and SMTP configurations. We should spike if it is possible to just "disable" these configurations in order to be able to just "enable" them on customer request.
fields.summary: Spike: Disable customer POP3 and SMTP configurations instead of deleting them

fields.description:
Requirement: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Customer+Facing+JIRA+Imports

The support team currently enables the indexing and triggers it after running the import.
fields.summary: Enable and perform indexing after import

fields.description: The current state is that at the end of the updateUsers() step the user gets redirected to the Crowd "AtlassianImporter" form. The form gets prefilled with the GET parameters provided, including the details (like password) in order to establish a JDBC connection to the JIRA database. Until now, the user just had to hit import since every necessary detail for the form got provided. Crowd recently changed the directory ids to be generated, so it is not possible (in an easy way) for us to pre-select the right directory anymore. Also, sending f.e. the password as a GET parameter exposes a security risk. The reason why the Studio Importer does it that way is because JIRA lacks a secure channel to Crowd. So James' idea is to enable Trusted Apps support for Crowd and provide a REST service for the user import so we can automate that step. The priority for that issue is low compared to the others since it wouldn't save the support team much time.
fields.summary: Automate Crowd import

fields.description: To reproduce create a review from a changeset in the <whatever> project. When you get to Crucible, it will prompt you for the project to create the review under.
fields.summary: Creating a review from JIRA FishEye Plugin forgets the project

fields.description:
Requirement: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer+Plugin?focusedCommentId=36569259#comment-36569259

The default JIRA path for attachments is "/data/jirastudio/jira/data/attachments" and has to be changed to "/data/jirastudio/jira/attachments" and the default path for indexes is "/data/jirastudio/jira/data/indexes" and has to be changed to "/data/jirastudio/jira/indexes". Additionally, the attachments have to be enabled after an import. These steps can be performed automatically f.e. in the postImportStudify() (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer#StudioImporter-SequenceDiagram) step since the paths are always the same in the customer instances.

Please ask mkight & jroper for further input on the functionality which to be provided.
fields.summary: Update index and attachments paths and enable attachments

fields.description:
Requirement: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Customer+Facing+JIRA+Imports

Currently all users are imported, disregarding whether the customer has proper licensing for that or not. The users should be deactivated before the doImport() (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer#StudioImporter-SequenceDiagram) step. Then the user should be provided with additional information whether the amount of collaborators and/or developers is supported on the users.vm screen. He should be able to choose which collaborators and/or developers get activated and tell him how many he can activate. While doing so, the screen should provide a client-side counter for how many licenses are still free for activating collaborators and developers. The final license check should be applied during the updateUsers (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer#StudioImporter-SequenceDiagram) step.

Please ask mknighten, mkight or jroper for further input on the functionality to be provided.
fields.summary: Add license check (number of active developers)
Studio link renderer renders a hard-coded text that appends to every issue created by email as a link to a non-existent wiki page

fields.description:
Requirement: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Customer+Facing+JIRA+Imports?focusedCommentId=37684227#comment-37684227

A version check should be added before working with a data import. The version may be lower or equal than the JIRA version if performing an "Instance" (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Customer+Facing+JIRA+Imports?focusedCommentId=37684227#comment-37684227) import.

Please ask dyu for further input on the functionality to be provided.
fields.summary: Add version check for "Instance" imports

fields.description:
Requirement: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer+Plugin?focusedCommentId=37683744#comment-37683744

The findOldJiraUrls (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer#StudioImporter-SequenceDiagram) step currently is not capable of working with zipped JIRA data files. It would be more convenient for support to work with zipped files like they are used to work with the JIRA im- and export.

Please ask mknight for further input on the functionality which should be provided.
fields.summary: Add unzip functionality for findOldJiraUrls(String)

fields.description:
Requirement: https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer+Plugin?focusedCommentId=37683851#comment-37683851

A new step (user interaction) should be added to the Data Importer in order to be able to consolidate/rename user(name)s. Probably the best way would be to add that functionality after the findOldJiraUrls()/updateJiraUrls(String) step (https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JST/Studio+Importer#StudioImporter-SequenceDiagram).

The consolidate/rename user screen should provide some server- and/or client-side batch support. F.e. selecting several users for a renaming after a certain regex or common patterns like lastname.firstname to firstname.lastname. Please ask mknight for further input on the functionality which to be provided.
fields.summary: Add rename/consolidate username step

fields.description:
The Google Documents Macro generates the "Edit" link to http://docs.google.com/a/domain.com/Doc?id=xxx

This works for documents created using the old version of Google document editor.

But for text documents created using the new version of Google document editor, this will link to an ugly "Not Found 404" page on Google Docs.

The edit link for documents created using the new version of Google document editor should be:
https://docs.google.com/a/domain.com/document/edit?id=xxx

Note that the protocol is now https in addition to the changes in the path and parameter.

Also note that the new edit link does not work for documents created using the old version of Google document editor, this will result in a "Google Docs Error" page.
fields.summary: The "Edit" link generated by Google Documents macro is not compatible with the latest version of the Google document editor

fields.description: These classes do not have a clearly defined responsibility. They have now grown to have large number of dependencies and methods.
fields.summary: Refactor all the StudioHelper classes

fields.description: AOD-2588 specifies that the "Bulk Edit User Access Level" is actually a more Studio-specific functionality and should be refactored out of the AGMP code.
fields.summary: Refactor "Bulk Edit User Access Level" out of AGMP into Studio

fields.description:
When trying to edit their profile, users are presented with a dialog to update their full name and email address. 
After filling this out and submitting, they are taken back to a similar dialog with blank fields. After filling this out and submitting again, they are still taken back to the same dialog with blank fields and the changes submitted do not take effect.
fields.summary: Cannot update user profile full name and email address

fields.description: Due to historical reasons, AGMP currently contains Studio-specific functionality. This functionality should be refactored out of the AGMP code into Studio in order to minimize or completely eliminate the dependencies AGMP has on Studio. This should not only be done for the sake of separation of concerns, but also in terms of an effort to make AGMP compatible with sole JIRA instances.
fields.summary: Remove AGMP's dependency on Studio

fields.description: As per [comment|https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-216#c17946] on CR-AOD-216
fields.summary: Refactor func test: break TestNavbarEncoding up and place the tests in TestCustomTabs, TestGlobalHistory and all TestXxxNavbar classes.

fields.description: This is so that we can more easily see changes to the test data.
fields.summary: Expand test data and have the studio maven plugin zip it up

fields.description:
The JIRA logout requires a token for XSRF detection, but we don't have this token to logout from any app. AGMP uses a custom logout action that extends JIRA's logout action.

Create a studio logout action that extends JIRA's, and then refactor AGMP to extend the Studio logout action.
fields.summary: Create a StudioLogout action, and refactor the AGMP logout to extend it

fields.description:
Currently the Activity Bar seems to rely on requests to the chat component before it finishes loading in the browser. This results in poor page load performance in environments where the requests to the chat component time out, e.g. strict firewalls.

To improve the situation we should consider:

1) changing the port the chat component listens on. Currently it listens on 8000, but a more common port like 8080 may work better. And,

2) changing the way the Activity Bar is loaded, such that it does not delay the loading of the main page content.
fields.summary: Improve the compatibilty and robustness of the Activity Bar

fields.description:
The default Bamboo behaviour is to keep all build data and build artifacts permanently. This could cause JIRA Studio customers to run out of disk space. Bamboo does have the ability to automatically expire either just the artifacts or all stored data after a certain period of time, but it may not be easy for customer admins to discover these options.

Maybe we could present the options on the form to enable Bamboo initially, so customers can set this up right away.
fields.summary: Prompt for global build expiry options when enabling Bamboo

fields.description: When adding new versions in the Manage Version UI within Administration, I would like to be able to update "Start Date" and version "Master" shown in the Greenhopper UI. Currently I have to create new Versions, then switch to Greenhopper to update those two fields.
fields.summary: Enhance the "Manage Versions" UI to support editing additional version fields shown in Greenhopper.

fields.description:
We have been using Jira Studio for Scrum with Greenhopper for a couple years now. We use different Versions as Sprint Backlogs, for tracking Sprints, and Unscheduled is the Product Backlog. I would like certain users (the Scrum Masters or Product Owners) to be able to create new Versions (Sprint Backlogs) prior to sprint planning sessions without having to have an Administrator account to do it.

The "Create Versions" UI elements would have to be exposed to these users as well (its currently only within the Administration area).
fields.summary: Create Issue - Project Permission elements to assign to users or groups to be able to create or modify "Versions".

fields.description: Currently if a Collaborator that is a member of the administrators group tries to create a new Studio Project, it will fail on the FishEye repo creation step.  Since Collaborators can't even access FishEye/SVN, they probably shouldn't be able to click on the Add Project link in Studio Admin.
fields.summary: Collaborator that is a member of the administrators group not able to create new Studio project

fields.description: We have made some changes to Bamboo which require a Bamboo release to get them into Studio 2.3.
fields.summary: Upgrade to Bamboo 2.6.2 with fixes for Studio 2.3
Add Sherpa plugin to Studio

fields.description: As I understand, this is required in order to make Sherpa work in Studio.
fields.summary: Upgrade to plugins 2.5
Upgrade Confluence to 3.3

fields.summary: remove studio custom gzip changes from JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 23 July 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

My name is Rak Garg, and I am a product manager at Atlassian. I have great news! We’re pleased to announce that IP allowlisting is now generally available for all Premium subscribers of Jira Software, Jira Service Desk, and Confluence. Learn more about this feature and find instructions on how to enable it on [our blog post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-articles/Keep-your-team-and-content-safe-with-IP-allowlisting-for/ba-p/1438293] or our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/ip-allowlisting-998658750.html].

I will be marking this ticket as closed, since the feature is now generally available. If you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to email me at rgarg@atlassian.com

Best,
Rak Garg
Atlassian Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Allow customers to configure IP allowlist

fields.description:
We don't currently have functional tests that actually run a build.

Furthermore, we don't have real EC2 account information to use from tests, so we have to use dummy info. In turn, this requires us to override code in Bamboo that validates your EC2 credentials so that it gets skipped during func tests.

See CR-AOD-223
fields.summary: Add functional tests for Bamboo building on EC2

fields.description:
Go2Group is interested in having their [SalesForce CRM plugin|http://www.go2group.com/display/PORTAL/Go2Group+CRM+plugin] approved for Studio.

https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/5198

Including functional tests, admin links, etc.
fields.summary: Bundle Go2Group CRM Plugin for JIRA

fields.description:
There are some test classes and methods that only test Bamboo. At the moment in the Bamboo-less build plan, these tests are run with some simple guards at the start of the method bodies.

It would be better to exclude such classes (and methods if possible) from being run at all in the Bamboo-less build plan. This could be done by a type and method level annotation, or a test group that isn't run on the bamless build.
fields.summary: Exclude Bamboo only tests from the test run when Bamboo is disabled
JIRA fails to start up with Java 6 u21

fields.description: Colors configured at studio-url/secure/admin/jira/ViewLookAndFeel.jspa are ignored when you view studio-url/wiki/admin/console.action.
fields.summary: Wiki Admin header does not use Studio Look and Feel settings

fields.description:
The *Source Information* on how to checkout the source is not visible if you're navigator the folders using the left-hand nav:

Example:
# http://test.jira.com/source/browse/AP
# Click /branches/1.0/
# The Source Information should now be missing.
# To make it appear, click "Activity" and then click "Files" again.
fields.summary: Source Information not displaying if navigating using the left-hand tree
Upgrade JIRA to 4.1.2 point release.

This should be handled gracefully. Granting the user permission to view the Google document avoids the problem.
fields.summary: NPE when opening a page with a Google Doc that the user does not have permission to view

fields.description: See [BAM-6211|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-6211] and AOD-2221.
fields.summary: Remove Java source files that overwrite Bamboo's classes that fixes BAM-6211 in Studio

fields.description:
[Fail|https://hosted.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JSTSTABLE-PLUGINS-40/test/case/20775447]

[Pass|https://hosted.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JSTSTABLE-PLUGINS-41]
fields.summary: Flaky test: TestStudioProjectDeletion

fields.description:
[Fail|https://hosted.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JSTSTABLE-PLUGINS-40/test/case/20775449]

[Fail|https://hosted.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JSTSTABLE-PLUGINS-40/test/case/20775448]

[Pass|https://hosted.bamboo.atlassian.com/browse/JSTSTABLE-PLUGINS-41]
fields.summary: Flaky tests: TestStreams

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the problem:-

* When trying to add a reviewer, there is no auto-complete being displayed when typing the username.
* The 'little people' icon doesn't shows a list of usernames when you clicked on it. Instead, it will direct you to the dashboard page.
* This can be reproducible at test.jira.com:
[http://test.jira.com/secure/project/crucible/CrucibleProject!ViewProject.jspa?key=PRA]
fields.summary: Add Reviewers in Crucible is not working properly

fields.description:
Go through the templates in studio-theme-bamboo-plugin and update them with changes the bamboo team have made between 2.5.1 and 2.6.1. Remove the custom templates if they are no longer needed, and update the .ftl.orig files also in studio-theme-bamboo-plugin.

Most of them are out of date and causing layout / javascript issues.
fields.summary: update templates in studio theme bamboo plugin

fields.description: Typing a keyword into the search box in upper-right gives some auto-complete search result possibilities.  Those are more relevant and accurate than if I click Enter to perform the search.  In fact, sometimes performing the search won't find the ticket of a specified number when performing the search, though the auto-complete drop down shows the correct ticket link.
fields.summary: Search box auto-complete has more-relevant search results than performing search

fields.description: If you configured studio to require an issue key for all commits, sometimes there are housekeeping commits that need to be opted out of this.  It might be useful to have a #noissue command that could be used to bypass the requirement temporarily.
fields.summary: Provide a built-in command (such as #noissue) to bypass the issue key requirement when that administrative option is ticked.

fields.description:
The administrative interface where you can require an issue key to make a commit seems to suggest that you can also provide an #open command to create a new issue.  This command is not supported by the precommit scripts used by Studio currently.  

We need to either fix this, or update the message that appears on the page /secure/admin/SvnCommitHooks.jspa and remove the reference to the #open command.
fields.summary: precommit command #open doesn't work on Studio

fields.description:
Current behaviours:
When no project is selected, both 'Dashboard' and 'Reviews' will show all reviews with no filter.
When a project is selected, 'Dashboard' still does the same, but 'Reviews' will show all reviews of the selected project (filtering only on project).

In AtlasEye, there is no concept of currently selected project, but both 'Dashboard' and 'Reviews' remember the previous settings.
fields.summary: 'Dashboard' and 'Reviews' in Review subnav don't remember previous settings

fields.description:
To replicate, first make sure there is a project in bamboo, then:
* go to http://localhost:2990/jira/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa?selectedCategory=all so that no project is selected
* click on the 'builds' tab
* project, user and history drop downs now do not work when clicked on
fields.summary: studio drop-down menus broken when no project selected
Administration user menu should not be displayed for project administrators

fields.description: The bundled plugin is still using 1.6. The latest version is 1.8.
fields.summary: Update Confluence Flying Pdf Plugin to the latest version
Refactor Seraph remember me servlet filter and JIRA login redirect servlet filter to studio-theme-fisheye plugin.

fields.description:
Go to Profile page and click on pencil icon next to user details. The form that opens will be empty and entered information are not accepted. 

Looks like studio overrides editprofile.jsp that was modified in Jira 4.1.1 but studio didn't update it's version of editprofile.vm.
fields.summary: Unable to edit user details from user profile page

fields.description:
For Studio instances that are accessed through HTTPS, Internet Explorer will issue mixed mode alerts on some FishEye and Crucible screens because it tries to load the IDE Connector image through HTTP.

The relevant FE issue is: http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-1890

The workaround is to instruct customers to turn off the 'Enable IDE icons' option in their FishEye profile. This can be accessed by clicking their username in the top-right of the screen and choosing 'Profile', then 'Tools' -> 'Source Preferences' (the option is down the bottom). This is a per-user option and it appears it cannot be set globally.
fields.summary: IE mixed mode warnings in some FE/Cru screens for HTTPS Studio instances

fields.description:
I will attach a screenshot on how it is affected, JIRA issue below:
* https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/SVN-258

David Chui also having the same problem as me.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Menus Are All Missing! Can't edit on issues!

fields.description: Even though Studio only supports elastic agents (no non-elastic or local agents are allowed), there are still references to installing a remote agent from within studio. See screenshots for details.
fields.summary: remove references to installing non-elastic remote agents
Bamboo provides incorrect instructions to SSH to an elastic instance

fields.description:
Crucible currently uses an HSQL database. This has proven to be quite fragile during upgrades and also difficult to restore when needed.

It would be ideal to migrate to PostgreSQL. More information is at: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Migrating+to+an+External+Database
fields.summary: Migrate Crucible from HSQL to Postgres

fields.description:
In order to increase the readership of our Studio-related blog posts, and the number of followers for @jirastudio, let's add links to them in the Studio footer. Here's some HTML from firebug that includes the correct links for the blog, RSS feed, and twitter account: {code}

Powered by JIRA Studio 2.2 | Terms of Use | Bug/feature request | Request Support | Help/Documentation | JIRA Studio Blog | @JIRAStudio

{code} !http://img.skitch.com/20100701-ej3ruh33s1fpu6w1ixbaw3gsgn.png!
fields.summary: Add links for JIRA Studio Blog & RSS Feed, @jirastudio to the Studio footer

fields.description: I can find no way to modify or delete a shared filter created by a user.
fields.summary: Administrator cannot modify a shared filter created by another user

fields.description:
At the moment, some of the apps include some CSS to hide AUI shadows when they are in the {{studio-header}} div. This is because not all apps played well with AUI shadows in the past. For example: AOD-2558.

After the recent round of app upgrades, we should revisit this and use AUI shadows for the studio theme drop downs if possible.
fields.summary: Use AUI shadows for Studio menu drop downs

fields.description: They are for Confluence, but I'm not sure they are for JIRA. Please make sure they are.
fields.summary: Enable Gliffy and Balsamiq trials by default
The Add Gadgets popup in JIRA Dashboard screen runs off the bottom of the page and cannot be moved in IE8. The popup is centered in other browsers such as FireFox

fields.description:
Some UI changes to Google admin-
* On Google User Management Screen, Change Jira to JIRA
* Move Bulk Edit User Access Level out of Google section, into regular admin - this is not Google specific functionality
* Collaps Google Preference section into menu item on regular JIRA Studio admin
fields.summary: Google Apps admin improvements

fields.description:
When we click on Create crucible review  for this changeset in <project> on a JIRA issue, it takes us to the following screen:

Select Project for New Review
<select List of projects, defaulting to one other than the one selected on the previous screen>
<create new review button>

It would be great if this worked as it did before the most recent upgrade where we created the review  from JIRA and immediately got into the review to set the reviewers instead of having to re-select the project and tell it a second time to create the review.
fields.summary: creating a crucible review from JIRA doesn't remember project.

fields.description: When viewing a build result, click on the changes and all the links listed, such as the files, versions and diffs all point to a wrong repository path, for instance, in StAC JST, the urls point to /source/browse/JIRA%20Studio/ instead of /source/browse/JST/trunk/
fields.summary: All code changes links to Fisheye in Bamboo build results are invalid.

fields.description: Our customisations to {{ConfigureElasticCloudAction}} include redirecting the user to the {{viewTermsAndConditions.ftl}} template to prompt them to read the hosted terms. Write a func test for this.
fields.summary: add func test for hosted terms of use page

fields.description: See also [AOD-1663]
fields.summary: Upgrade task to disable gzip compression in confluence, jira

fields.description: The font is almost unreadable.  Did you revert back to DOS?  Please the see the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: when editing "description" or "environment" field of jira issues on PC FF3.5.10 or IE8 the font is almost unreadable
Builds tab in Admin section labelled "studio.tab.builds" after selecting Wiki tab

fields.description:
If you are updating/closing/managing multiple sub-tasks on a parent task it can be quite frustrating to have to scroll down to the issue list after each change. Since the studio upgrade which pushes the sub-task/issue list below the fold, this has become very noticeable. 

A cheap fix could be loading the page as <issue_url>?selectedIssueId=<edited_issue_id>#issuetable
fields.summary: After editing/updating sub-tasks using the action drop down on the issue list (while on the parent task) the page no longer focuses the issue list

fields.description:
Collaborator who is member of Administrators group can see link to create a studio project, but project creation fails with message "Creation of XXX repository failed" without stating any details. 

This user can also see Source/Review/Builds admin interface, but can't do much there either because of the collaborator user type. 

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-7757

Collaborators shouldn't see those screens, or error reporting should be improved.
fields.summary: Collaborator with administration rights encounters errors when creating new project.

fields.description: In Jira Studio's Greenhopper, the agile boards can only display information from only one project at a time. We have three projects, and although we keep the projects separate, we plan for and work on all three together, since we have one team and shared resources for all three projects. It is difficult to switch among the three project views for planning and task management, so we'd like Greenhopper to have an option display all projects (or specified projects) at once.
fields.summary: View all projects together in Greenhopper Planning/task board

fields.description:
The search over the StudioSearch action (Studio Theme plugin) doesn't return Fisheye search results. If Fisheye search is used with the same query, results are returned.

This is reproducible on the Studio trunk, just search for "test". We've isolated the problem so far that the /plugins/servlet/studio/search?query=test%26maxhits%3D5%26application%3DFishEye servlet on Fisheye doesn't return any results, but the /qsearch?q=test servlet does.
fields.summary: No Fisheye search results over StudioSearch action
User picker does not work in Review Defaults admin screen.

fields.description: The Charts View popup works fine in JAC on IE8.
fields.summary: The Charts View popup in Issue Navigator screen runs off the bottom of the page and cannot be moved in IE8. The popup is centered in other browsers such as FireFox

fields.description:
On Jira Studio, I use a SVN repository with Eclipse and subversive or subclipse plugin

When commiting to the repository, I often have the following error :

svn: Commit failed (details follow):
svn: Broken pipe
svn: PUT request failed on '/svn/!svn/wrk/06d6927a-2901-0010-a2ed-91aaa073dc31/TEST/{project-name}/war/WEB-INF/lib/appengine-api-1.0-sdk-1.3.4.jar'

Thank you for your help
fields.summary: SVN : broken pipe

fields.description:
Hi - 

I would like to request that the following 3rd party plugins be installed into our account:

Jython Script Studio:  https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/16346
Workflow Viewer:  https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/10622

These 2 plugins would be enormously useful in our attempts to create custom and powerful workflows.

Thanks,
-Julio
fields.summary: Request to install Jython Scripting Studio and JIRA Workflow Designer
Install and test GH 5 on Studio 2.2
Support fix for in commit commands

fields.description:
We saw this happen on labs.atlassian.com, which uses the Crowd-default (rather than Studio-default) token key.  After upgrading to 2.2, the FishEye Crowd properties were changed back to the Studio default.

This only affects internal Atlassian instances that are configured to use an external Crowd: labs and SPAC. So it is not a very high priority. Still, it would be a good idea to investigate whether this is likely to happen on _every_ upgrade, because that could get annoying if it has to be fixed manually each time.
fields.summary: Upgrades may reset non-standard Crowd SSO cookie names in FishEye

fields.description:
The authz permissions lists _bamboo-svn-user in some projects but without any permissions:

For example:

{code}
[groups]
developers = 
administrators = 
users = 
_no-one-at-all = 
[/XFSDFS]
@developers = rw
@administrators = rw
@users = r
@_no-one-at-all = r
_bamboo-svn-user = 
{code}

How it got to this state is a bit of a mystery.

Bamboo plan log shows:
{code}
com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Unable to retrieve source code to 'latest' for 'XCFDFXF': svn: Authentication required for ' Subversion Repository'
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.svn.SvnRepository.retrieveSourceCode(SvnRepository.java:416)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.task.CheckoutUpdateForBuild.call(CheckoutUpdateForBuild.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent.build(DefaultBuildAgent.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl.waitAndPerformBuild(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent$1.run(DefaultBuildAgent.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.concurrent.NamedThreadFactory$1.run(NamedThreadFactory.java:33)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:595)
Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNAuthenticationException: svn: Authentication required for ' Subversion Repository'
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.authenticationFailed(SVNErrorManager.java:47)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.authenticationFailed(SVNErrorManager.java:41)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.DefaultSVNAuthenticationManager.getNextAuthentication(DefaultSVNAuthenticationManager.java:203)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.http.HTTPConnection.request(HTTPConnection.java:539)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.http.HTTPConnection.request(HTTPConnection.java:273)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.http.HTTPConnection.request(HTTPConnection.java:261)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVConnection.exchangeCapabilities(DAVConnection.java:516)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.io.dav.DAVConnection.open(DAVConnection.java:98)
{code}
fields.summary: _bamboo-svn-user denied access to some projects

fields.description:
The {{studio-project-creation}} thread that {{SetupBamboo}} starts fails to create the projects but thinks it has succeeded.

From atlassian-bamboo.log:

{noformat}
2010-06-23 15:18:20,993 INFO [BAM::Events:pool-1-thread-1] [SetupBamboo] Remote agents enabled
2010-06-23 15:18:20,998 INFO [BAM::Events:pool-1-thread-1] [SetupBamboo] Studio Bamboo is now setup! :D
2010-06-23 15:18:21,019 INFO [BAM::Events:pool-1-thread-1] [SetupBamboo] Scheduling project creation task
2010-06-23 15:19:41,210 WARN [studio-project-creation1] [TrustEstablisher] Trust request FAILURE. Problem doing PUT request on URL "http://localhost:2990/jira/plugins/servlet/applinks/trusted?url=http://localhost:6990/builds" for trust: com.atlassian.sal.api.net.ResponseException: Maximum number of retries (2) reached.
2010-06-23 15:19:43,874 INFO [studio-project-creation1] [SetupBamboo] Successfully created all projects
{noformat}
fields.summary: studio project creation fails
